location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: 'MAP 16 MAP TO ILLUSTRATE THE FIRST ATTACK ON HANNA. 21st. January, 1916.'

physicalDescription.extent: Materials: Printed in colour on paperDimensions: 257 x 269mm, on sheet 333 x 318mm

mods.abstract: The map accompanies The Campaign in Mesopotamia 1914-1918. Volume II, and shows a region around the Hanna defile to the west of the confluence of the River Tigris and the River Wadi [Nahr al Wādī] in central and eastern Iraq, indicating military operations, settlements, rivers and marshes.Prepared in the Historical Section of the Committee of Imperial Defence, and printed at the Ordnance Survey in 1924.
